unit: Unit 9 | Inference for Quantitative Data: Slopes
title: What Does it Mean?
question_text: Which of the following is the correct way to state a claim for results of a $98\%$ confidence interval about the slope of a regression model?

choices.text: We are 98 % 98 % confident that we know the true slope of the population model.
We are 98 % 98 % confident that the true slope of the population model will be at the center of our confidence interval.
If random sampling is done over and over, we know that about 98 % 98 % of the confidence intervals created would contain the true slope of the population  model.

If random sampling is done over and over, we know that about 98 % 98 % of the time we would know that the mean of our confidence interval created would contain the true slope of the population  model.
We are 98 % 98 % confident that we would find the exact slope of the population model.
